definition: to die (Buddhism)
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
see 返璞歸真|返璞归真[fan3 pu2 gui1 zhen1]

sentences.english: The marriage was to last until Khadijah died.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻持續到赫蒂傑歸真。

sentences.english: His problem is that of the complicated man recovering his original simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 他的問題是一個變得複雜了的人如何返璞歸真的問題。

sentences.english: Back to Basics. This is the New Traditional Style.
sentences.chinese: 返璞歸真，這是新的傳統風格。

sentences.english: But the Prophet passed away before the coming of the next year.
sentences.chinese: 但在來年之前穆聖就歸真了。

sentences.english: I think we are getting back to basics.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我們都返樸歸真。

sentences.english: What people pursue nowadays is simplicity and nature, isn't it?.
sentences.chinese: 現代人不就追求反樸歸真嗎？簡單就是美。

sentences.english: The birthplace of kindergarten is returning to its roots.
sentences.chinese: 幼兒園的誕生地正在走上返樸歸真的道路。

sentences.english: At her death, she was buried outside Makkah in a grave dug by the Prophet himself.
sentences.chinese: 她歸真後，葬在麥加外穆聖親自挖的一個墳墓裏。

sentences.english: The pure and simple style of this restaurant's decoration is really unique.
sentences.chinese: 這家飯店的裝飾反璞歸真，很有特色。

sentences.english: Sometimes, though, simple tools like this are exactly what it takes to bring usback to the basics.
sentences.chinese: 但有時正是這些簡單工具讓我們返璞歸真。

sentences.english: His problem was that of the complicated man seeking simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 他的問題是一個複雜的人如何返樸歸真。

sentences.english: The aim of precepts, admonished believers the good and evil, leaving comments on basics.
sentences.chinese: 其目的在於教誡，勸誡教徒們爲善止惡，棄妄歸真。

sentences.english: He wants to give away all his modern possessions and return to nature.
sentences.chinese: 他要捨棄一切時髦的東西而歸真返璞。
我個人意見是返樸歸真。

definition: to grow old with unfailing eyes and ears (idiom)
the five impurities (Buddhism)
to hide (from the world)
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to practice Chan Buddhist meditation/to practice Zen meditation/to sit in meditation
pleasant/happy
to return/to come back
Buddhism subtleties/Buddhist allegory
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
apprehension/apprehensive
upright/straightforward
to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
person with foresight
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
